intro: Melocactus, commonly known as the "hedgehog cactus," is a genus of cacti native to South America. These plants are characterized by their short, cylindrical stems covered in spines that resemble the bristles of a hedgehog. Melocactus species typically have a dense covering of white or yellow spines, which help protect them from herbivores and reduce water loss. They produce small, colorful flowers that bloom in shades of red, yellow, or orange. Due to their slow growth and unique appearance, they are popular among cactus enthusiasts and often cultivated in arid environments.
